speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: SCENE VII. Another part of the field.

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Alarum: excursions. Enter TALBOT led by a Servant

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Where is my other life? mine own is gone;

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: O, where's young Talbot? where is valiant John?

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Triumphant death, smear'd with captivity,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Young Talbot's valour makes me smile at thee:

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: When he perceived me shrink and on my knee,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: His bloody sword he brandish'd over me,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: And, like a hungry lion, did commence

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Rough deeds of rage and stern impatience;

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: But when my angry guardant stood alone,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Tendering my ruin and assail'd of none,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Dizzy-eyed fury and great rage of heart

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Suddenly made him from my side to start

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Into the clustering battle of the French;

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: And in that sea of blood my boy did drench

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: His over-mounting spirit, and there died,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: My Icarus, my blossom, in his pride.

speaker: Servant
text_entry: O, my dear lord, lo, where your son is borne!

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Enter Soldiers, with the body of JOHN TALBOT

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Thou antic death, which laugh'st us here to scorn,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Anon, from thy insulting tyranny,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Coupled in bonds of perpetuity,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Two Talbots, winged through the lither sky,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: In thy despite shall 'scape mortality.

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: O, thou, whose wounds become hard-favour'd death,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Speak to thy father ere thou yield thy breath!

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Brave death by speaking, whether he will or no;

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Imagine him a Frenchman and thy foe.

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Poor boy! he smiles, methinks, as who should say,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Had death been French, then death had died to-day.

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Come, come and lay him in his father's arms:

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: My spirit can no longer bear these harms.

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Soldiers, adieu! I have what I would have,

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Now my old arms are young John Talbot's grave.

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Dies

speaker: TALBOT
text_entry: Enter CHARLES, ALENCON, BURGUNDY, BASTARD OF ORLEANS, JOAN LA PUCELLE, and forces

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Had York and Somerset brought rescue in,

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: We should have found a bloody day of this.

speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
text_entry: How the young whelp of Talbot's, raging-wood,

speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
text_entry: Did flesh his puny sword in Frenchmen's blood!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Once I encounter'd him, and thus I said:

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: 'Thou maiden youth, be vanquish'd by a maid:'

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: But, with a proud majestical high scorn,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: He answer'd thus: 'Young Talbot was not born

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: To be the pillage of a giglot wench:'

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: So, rushing in the bowels of the French,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: He left me proudly, as unworthy fight.

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Doubtless he would have made a noble knight;

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: See, where he lies inhearsed in the arms

speaker: BURGUNDY
text_entry: Of the most bloody nurser of his harms!

speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
text_entry: Hew them to pieces, hack their bones asunder

speaker: BASTARD OF ORLEANS
text_entry: Whose life was England's glory, Gallia's wonder.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: O, no, forbear! for that which we have fled

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: During the life, let us not wrong it dead.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Enter Sir William LUCY, attended; Herald of the French preceding

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Herald, conduct me to the Dauphin's tent,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: To know who hath obtained the glory of the day.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: On what submissive message art thou sent?

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Submission, Dauphin! 'tis a mere French word;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: We English warriors wot not what it means.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: I come to know what prisoners thou hast ta'en

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And to survey the bodies of the dead.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: For prisoners ask'st thou? hell our prison is.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: But tell me whom thou seek'st.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: But where's the great Alcides of the field,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Valiant Lord Talbot, Earl of Shrewsbury,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Created, for his rare success in arms,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Great Earl of Washford, Waterford and Valence;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Lord Talbot of Goodrig and Urchinfield,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Lord Strange of Blackmere, Lord Verdun of Alton,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Lord Cromwell of Wingfield, Lord Furnival of Sheffield,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: The thrice-victorious Lord of Falconbridge;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Knight of the noble order of Saint George,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Worthy Saint Michael and the Golden Fleece;

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Great marshal to Henry the Sixth

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Of all his wars within the realm of France?

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Here is a silly stately style indeed!

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: The Turk, that two and fifty kingdoms hath,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Writes not so tedious a style as this.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Him that thou magnifiest with all these titles

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: Stinking and fly-blown lies here at our feet.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Is Talbot slain, the Frenchmen's only scourge,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Your kingdom's terror and black Nemesis?

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: O, were mine eyeballs into bullets turn'd,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: That I in rage might shoot them at your faces!

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: O, that I could but call these dead to life!

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: It were enough to fright the realm of France:

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Were but his picture left amongst you here,

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: It would amaze the proudest of you all.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: Give me their bodies, that I may bear them hence

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: And give them burial as beseems their worth.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: I think this upstart is old Talbot's ghost,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: He speaks with such a proud commanding spirit.

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: For God's sake let him have 'em; to keep them here,

speaker: JOAN LA PUCELLE
text_entry: They would but stink, and putrefy the air.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Go, take their bodies hence.

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: I'll bear them hence; but from their ashes shall be rear'd

speaker: LUCY
text_entry: A phoenix that shall make all France afeard.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: So we be rid of them, do with 'em what thou wilt.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: And now to Paris, in this conquering vein:

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: All will be ours, now bloody Talbot's slain.

speaker: CHARLES
text_entry: Exeunt
